summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 regarding the scheduling and logistics for FBI agents to facilitate Ghislaine Maxwell's review of sensitive discovery materials at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). It details the coordination between FBI personnel and Maxwell's attorney, emphasizing that agents are not to speak with Maxwell directly.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the discovery review; an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) who is to review sensitive discovery materials with her attorney present.

connections.description: L is an FBI agent assigned to facilitate Maxwell's review of discovery materials at the detention center, with strict instructions not to engage her in conversation.

events.title: Maxwell Discovery Review Session
events.description: A scheduled session at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) from 8am to 3pm for Ghislaine Maxwell to review sensitive discovery materials with her attorney present, facilitated by FBI agents.

events.title: Cancelled Meeting
events.description: A meeting scheduled for Tuesday, October 20, 2020, between Maxwell and her attorney for discovery review was cancelled by the attorney, requiring rescheduling.

locations: 290/26 Fed (likely referring to 290 Broadway, New York, NY 10007, a federal building)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in October 2020.
FBI agents were tasked with facilitating Maxwell's review of sensitive discovery materials using a secure laptop, with strict instructions not to speak with her.
Maxwell's attorney was required to be present during the discovery review sessions.
Coordination for the review involved scheduling conflicts and last-minute changes, indicating active pre-trial preparation.
